p.s: In his comment with the title Language learning in the UK: 'can't, won't, don't' John Worne mentions the need of foreign languages in many aspects.
To show how important it is, he uses argument and makes use of studies.
He also addresseesadresses the parent-being reader.

John Worne, the author, first explains the meaning of the title of his comment (ll. 1f), which is Language learning in the UK: 'can't, won't, don't' and describes the situation of speaking foreign languages in the UK.
Furthermore, he just lists the fact that the studying of foreign languages in the UK is steady decline and there is no interest to do something for it (ll. 3ff).
That shows his opinion clearly and displays the problem, but it has no evidence so it is not very serious.
Something else what he uses all the text are we, us our-pronouns (l. 1).
Using of pronouns like this effects a sense of community and it seems like he is directly talking to the reader.
This is also a way to convince the reader with mentioning a study in his comment, John Worne makes his text seem more serious (ll. 9ff).
He also mentions the exams of the schools to test their language.
This are the evidence of a good increasing language knowledge for the people from the UK.
After this the author lists some arguments which display the benefits of the language now.
But they get refuterefuted to show that there are some aspects, which were not thought of (ll. 12-15).
In the following, Worne says why language learning is so important for the nation (l. 16) and what it is essential for (l. 17f).
This has the effect that the reader can see what is maybe missing in the language knowledge of the nation and maybe it could even motivate and inform people.
After this, he mentions a survey about education and skills, which showed that almost 2/3 of the buisnessesbusinesses in the UK have the need to use foreign language (ll. 19f).
So there would be a destabilization of the concerns if they would not stop the massive outsourcing because of the missing language skills.
Using this serveysurvey makes him more serious and even more interesting.
In the end he appeals parent-being reader to develop the skils of language of the future workers.
The language he uses is very simple and easy to understand so everybody who is interested can read and understand it.
In conclusion the author talks mostly with the reader to wake interest and inform the reader about this topic.
Appealing the parent-being reader makes a group more interested.
